text: When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you. You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen.

I looked around for someone to ask. I saw a man who looked like me. He had similar clothes, gender, hair, and seemed to be from a more recent era. Many of the people had older clothing, from the 50s, 60s, 70s, and 80s, but his outfit looked modern. 

"Excuse me," I said to him. "Can you tell me where I am?" 
"You're in the cinema," he said. "You died, and now you're watching your next life." 
"But what is this place?" I said. "Is it a world-between-worlds?" 
"No," he said. "This is the cinema."  Finding him very useless, I approached the woman next to him. 
"Excuse me," I said to her.  "Where am I?" 
"You're in the cinema," she said. 

Nobody I asked was able to answer my questions, and indeed, the whole theater stared like zombies at the screen, waiting for the show to begin.  I suddenly noticed a female version of myself, quietly beckoning me over.  She put finger to her lips, and pointed to one of the stage doors, off to the side. Intrigued, I began to head toward her.  Suddenly, I heard a loud gruff voice behind me. "Stop! Don't let the anomaly escape"
